text:
e="preserve">José Salcedo (c. 1949 – 19 September 2017) was a Spanish movie editor with over 120 feature movie credits. He had an extended collaboration with the director Pedro Almodóvar, having edited all of Almodóvar's movies since 1980. He was born in Ciudad Real, Spain.
Salcedo had been nominated many times for Goya Awards for movie editing, and won the award three times: for "Women on the Verge of a Nervous Breakdown" (1988), "Nobody Will Speak of Us When We're Dead" (1995), and "All About My Mother" (1999).
Salcedo died on 19 September 2017 in Madrid, Spain at the age of 68.

annotations.surface_form: Women on the Verge of a Nervous Breakdown
Nobody Will Speak of Us When We're Dead
